Yes, there are some foods and drinks that can promote better sleep hygiene. Here are a few examples:

1. Warm milk: Warm milk contains tryptophan, an amino acid that can help induce sleep. 2. Herbal tea: Chamomile, valerian, passionflower, and other herbal teas are known to promote relaxation and improve sleep quality. 3. Cherries: Cherries contain melatonin, a hormone that regulates the sleep-wake cycle. Eating cherries or drinking cherry juice can help improve sleep. 4. Bananas: Bananas contain magnesium and potassium, two minerals that help promote muscle relaxation and improve sleep quality. 5. Whole grain crackers or bread: These foods are a good source of carbohydrates that can help increase the level of tryptophan in the brain, which helps induce sleep. 6. Leafy greens: Leafy greens such as kale, spinach, and collard greens are rich in magnesium and can help promote relaxation and better sleep quality. It's important to note that everyone's body reacts differently to food, so it's important to experiment with different foods and see what works best for you in promoting better sleep hygiene.
